Course Section: PORT_V 392-201 - Studies in Portuguese and Brazilian Literature (in English)
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
This course offers a panoramic view of modern and contemporary Brazilian cinema and literature in relation to history, social dynamics, diversity, politics, and language.Â 
PORT 392 and RMST 361 are the same course. Please register as RMST 361.Â 

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst361/Â Â 

Language of Instruction: EnglishÂ 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/Â

PPGA 391A: Human Rights in a Globalized WorldÂ 
About the CourseThis course offers a unique opportunity for undergraduate students to gain hands-on experience in the field of human rights work. The course takes an interdisciplinary lens to exploring the theory and practice of human rights work in a globalized world. Students will learn the opportunities and impediments in rights-based work, and will participate in experiential learning activities. Through case studies and examples from different disciplines, students will better understand the diverse and increasingly complex body of human rights work. The course is open to students in Year 3 and above.
